attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in Theresa May as P.M
attributes.background: Theresa May has had a one house race to become prime minister without anyone voting for her outside of parliament. Therefor a General Election should be called within 1 year.

attributes.action: Put Anglo Saxon history,  on the national curriculum for secondary schools.
attributes.background: To many people the history of our country starts with William the Conqueror.  But there is a long and colourful history before this. A history that includes the formation of our country, the laying down of laws that are still in use today and the only English king ti be given the moniker "The Great"

attributes.action: Increase the penalty for those involved in the puppy farm trade.
attributes.background: Puppy farming is one of the largest contributors of animal cruelty within Britain. No animal should have to go through the distress and abusive conditions that happen within this barbaric industry. Those who take part in this trade should suffer a heavy penalty for this act of cruelty.

attributes.action: Remove the Under 10m Inshore fishing vessels from the quota system.
attributes.background:
The quota system has been a nightmare for the fishing industry and fish stocks in general. The disgusting practice of throwing back good quality fish that are dead or have no chance of survival must be stopped.
Quota systems simply do not work in mixed fisheries.
attributes.additional_details:
In other countries such as Norway (that are not in the EU and bound by unmanageable rules and regulations) small inshore vessels are excluded from quota's and they have a thriving industry and healthy fish stocks.
Everybody understands the need for conservation and the quota system needs replacing with a more sustainable and environmentally friendly method such as limited days at sea and/or fishing gear restrictions. 
Throwing back dead fish is immoral and wrong and must be stopped.

attributes.action: Improve policies,procedures and legal requirements associated with Gas Safety
attributes.background: Although engineers must be Gas Safe registered to work on boilers and other gas appliances, the policies, procedures and legal requirements around this are so vague that people without the necessary skill and knowledge are putting peoples homes and lives at danger.
attributes.additional_details:
To ensure that only gas safe engineers are able to complete gas related works, we would like to make the following legal requirements.
- Retailers are able to sell Gas related products, parts and materials to registered engineers who show their card at the time of purchase.
- Gas Safe Engineers are required to present their card before entering a customers home when completing any gas work
- No commercial contracts made that relate to gas work without the inclusion of a gas safety registration number and copy of a gas card

attributes.action: Change the law so the councils must scan all dead pets for a microchip.
attributes.background:
Most people assume their cat would be scanned if found dead and collected by the council, and that they would be informed, but this is simply not the case. 

When a cat gets killed in a traffic accident, the councils have no legal obligation to scan for a microchip. This need to change.
attributes.additional_details:
The scanners are relatively cheap (£40) and all councils have them already to scan the stray dogs, since they are obliged to do that.

The change in law will be easy and inexpensive to implement. 
It will also save a lot of pet owners from the pain of not knowing what happened to their beloved pets.

attributes.action: Allow Parliament a vote on planned Hinkley Point C/Bradwell nuclear power plants
attributes.background: The decision to accept the investment  from EDF and China to design, build and operate the first new ( as yet untested) nuclear power stations in a generation must be made only with the consent of parliament.
attributes.additional_details: Just a retired engineer who I believe represents the mass of public opinion

attributes.action: Extend paid maternity leave for mums who have premature babies in hospital.
attributes.background: After having a premature baby at 26+1 gestation and having spent 13 weeks in hospital. That's a third of my maternity leave used without having my baby home. Many other mums have the same problem not being able to take the unpaid leave due to not being able to afford it.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that if you have a baby more than 10 weeks early that has a long hospital stay, you should be able to apply for extended maternity pay and not start your official maternity leave till your baby is home so that you get the same privilege as a mum who has a full term baby with 9months paid at home with your child.

attributes.action: Help stop the suffering in Syria
attributes.background: We ask the UK Government to use its international powers to end the deliberate targeting of civilians and civilian infrastructure in Syria, negotiate access routes with Turkey and other countries which could help for medics and medical supplies to Syria.

attributes.action: Form a Select Committee on the causes of the recent rise in xenophobic behaviour
attributes.background: Police report that hate crimes have increased substantially since the EU referendum, which has been taken by some to legitimise racist & xenophobic activity. Politicians of all parties must work together to oppose this, and avoid encouraging such behaviour with careless statements and actions
attributes.additional_details: A  Select Committee should provide an opportunity for politicians to consider whether (inadvertently or not) their statements and actions have contributed to the present deplorable situation. It should also focus on exposing those elements of the media which are peddling misinformation and fostering hatred. Members of Parliament, working across party lines, should develop strategies to oppose racism and xenophobia and demand effective action from the Government.

attributes.action: Debate the cost of gluten free food and why more isn't done to help families
attributes.background:
My daughter has just been diagnosed with celiac disease and I was so surprised at the amount of money it costs just to buy simple food . And the lack of variety available 
 Also how bad the packaging is labelled informing you of the ingredients

attributes.action: To abolish the tv licence fee completely
attributes.background: I am trying to get the outdated tv licence fee abolished and let it get private donations like sky or virgin

attributes.action: After the EU vote, we call for the dismantlement of the unelected House of Lords
attributes.background: As the UK has voted to "take back control" from the EU from what was claimed to be a democratically unaccountable Brussels, we propose that the UK should follow this line of reasoning and "take back control" from the un-elected House of Lords by dissolving it.
attributes.additional_details:
The British Parliament contains one of the world's largest decision making bodies called the House of Lords. The peers of this House are un-elected. 

In the EU, the British people could appoint European members of Parliament. But the elected European Parliament is also complemented by un-elected Institutions. The British confirmed they do not want to be apart of this. As the House of Lords is in the British Parliament, the British people have the capability to remove this un-elected House.

attributes.action: Stop outsourcing our NHS services to outside Companies
attributes.background: I feel it is totally wrong to outsource our NHS services to private Companies, such as Richard Branson's & feel that the government is slowly beginning to privatize our National Health Service. This must not happen!

attributes.action: Ensure Bill Of Rights affords as much protection for vegans as Human Rights Act.
attributes.background:
By protecting vegans from discrimination and bullying, the Human Rights Act makes it easier to stay vegan - indirectly reducing animal exploitation.

But leaving the EU, and replacing the Human Rights Act with a Bill Of Rights, puts such protection at risk.

More at http://veganrights.uk
attributes.additional_details:
If the UK remains a party to the European Convention on Human Rights, vegans may have to rely on foreign courts (in Strasbourg) for protection.

But if the UK also withdraws from the European Convention on Human Rights, vegans may not be protected at all.

So either way, it is vital that the Government's Bill of Rights, intended to replace the Human Rights Act, provides just as much protection.

We would also expect to see the same protection for all other groups currently protected by the Act.

attributes.action: Remove all religious representatives from any Parliamentary institution.
attributes.background: Our Government should be 100% secular and should have no religious bias from any religious group. This means removing The Lords Spiritual from the House of Lords and removing any religious ceremony or act from any part of Parliamentary processes.
attributes.additional_details: The lack of secularism in our society promotes inequality through the definition of people and organisations by their affiliation to religious institutions. To combat inequality, our Political Leaders must be independent of all religious influence, irrespective of the religion, so that all decisions can be made in a fair and balanced way. This independence cannot be accomplished whilst we have members of one religious institution in Parliament in any form.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of Castle Armoury Bury.
attributes.background: Castle Armoury is a Grade II listed building and is currently occupied by a Platoon of Fusiliers. For over 100 years the building has been in use by Fusiliers in their home town of Bury. We believe that so long as their are Fusiliers in Bury, Castle Armoury should be their home.
attributes.additional_details: Plans have recently been announced that after 100 years of continuous use Castle Armoury is to be sold. The occupying Fusilier Platoon is to be moved to a as yet unannounced location along with the Army and Air Cadets. Since before the start of the First World War the building has been occupied by the Fusiliers and stands as the final link between Fusiliers of the present and those who went away to war never to return. The building is still in use and occupied by serving soldiers.

attributes.action: Recognise care work is a skilled job and put a banding system in place
attributes.background: The average care worker is paid the minimum wage give or take 5%, regardless of whether or not they have experience and qualifications. It is said to be unskilled, yet there are various care qualifications sought after by employers. Why? Because care work is a skilled job which requires training!
attributes.additional_details: The current care system fails both care workers and service users. I propose that HCAs have a banding system. Band 1 will be apprentice carers, paid the minimum wage, band 2 will be level 2 carers and be paid 25%+ above minimum wage, band 3 (senior) +50%, and band 4 (deputy/coordinator) +75%. I also propose band 1 cannot lone work until 6 months shadowing has been done. This will encourage training, ensuring the quality of care provided is of the standard it desperately needs to be!

attributes.action: The law on WPA (widowed parents allowance) needs to be updated.
attributes.background: Currently those with children who are not married are not entitled to financial help with bereavement payments.
attributes.additional_details:
The discrimination of children from cohabiting couples rather than married ones is inconsistent with our human rights policy.
Please sign this petition to force the government to bring this benefit to all vulnerable families not only those with married parents.

attributes.action: Make not paying a taxi/private hire soiling fee a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Why is the soiling fee not a criminal offence when not paying the fare on the meter is a criminal offence.

So many times drivers are put off the road while they get there car cleaned and back up to standard, why should the driver be out of pocket when it was no fault of the driver.

attributes.action: BRCA - Provide a consistent approach to advice, care and support across the UK
attributes.background: There is an inconsistent approach to advice, care and support given to BRCA women and men across the UK. Women and men are being diagnosed with cancer every day when it could have been prevented. Let's make this change.
attributes.additional_details:
A questionnaire is currently underway to collate the inconsistencies from the health care. But some examples so far are;
1. Surveillance options for breast and Ovarian Cancer varies (available in some areas)
2. Assigned geneticists 
3. Inconsistent advice for BSO  
4. Availability of PGD / IVF 
5. Waiting times to see the breast surgeons
6. Availability of testing 

These are some. I am BRCA1 positive, Ambassador for BRCA Umbrella and Voice for OCA. I see it every day and it needs changing.

attributes.action: All Vegan products on sale in the UK should bear a standard identifying logo.
attributes.background: Shopping for Vegan products in the UK is notoriously difficult. Especially for those who are even the slightly visually impaired as ingredient lists are often in tiny print. This should include all food & drink products, health care & beauty products and clothing including shoes.

attributes.action: Keep trains running between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage after 2018.
attributes.background: Hertfordshire County Council calls on the Government to take action to accelerate the infrastructure works at Stevenage station, to enable Govia Thameslink Railway (GTR) to run trains between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage after 2018.
attributes.additional_details:
GTR has proposed changes to its new timetable, which include a replacement shuttle bus service between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage from 2018. This has been blamed on delays to the construction of a fifth platform at Stevenage, which has been pushed back by Network Rail into its work programme for 2019-24.

The council calls on the Department for Transport to work with Network Rail to bring forward the implementation of the fifth platform and keep this important rail link in operation.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum should cannabis be legalized.
attributes.background: Cannabis has been used as medicine for thousands of years let the people decide if we should have access to this medicine in a regulated way or not.

attributes.action: Increase maximum sentencing for animal cruelty from 6 months.
attributes.background: The maximum penalty is 6 months’ imprisonment and/or an unlimited fine. The financial element of the penalty was raised only last year from a maximum fine of £20,000.
attributes.additional_details: For this to be discussed in parliament there must be 100 000 signatures. I recently signed the same petition but it only got to 50 000.

attributes.action: Introduce government funding for The Medical Detection Dogs charity.
attributes.background: Dogs can be trained to detect certain cancers in urine samples, quickly, accurately and at less cost to the NHS. They make possible the earlier identification  of some difficult to detect cancers. They can also assist people by alerting them to imminent medical dangers. Yet they receive no funding.
attributes.additional_details: This charity has changed the lives of individuals with diabetes, epilepsy, narcolepsy and serious allergies, by giving them greater security and independence. The Medical Assistance  dogs help their confidence and general well being and in some cases enables them to lead a normal life. The charity saves the NHS more money by reducing the emergency call out incidents. Its worthwhile work could be extended to help many more people, given money and recognition.

attributes.action: Improve Testing for Lyme disease in UK and Treatment Guidelines
attributes.background: Lyme disease within the UK is a big problem and the NHS is refusing to recognize this, leaving many patients to spend thousands on private treatment or suffer in silence

attributes.action: Stop HS2! Spend the money on the NHS
attributes.background: We need to scrap this project and reinvest the money in the NHS. Either that or refurbish the existing transport network. Save our tax money! Save our countryside! Save our towns and villages! Save our community's! And Save our homes!

attributes.action: Allow the British people to bear arms again
attributes.background: Because of the constant threat of islamic terrorism the British people should be allowed to bear arms in order to protect their families,
attributes.additional_details: Throughout Europe Islamic terrorists have killed hundreds of innocent people & to try to save lives then the British public should once again be allowed to carry guns to defend their loved ones from harm, We the British people want the same rights afforded to the people of the USA, France & Germany who do have the means to defend themselves when needed!!!

attributes.action: Highways England to set 50mph speed limit on A34 between Chieveley & West Ilsley
attributes.background: The A34 between Chieveley and West Ilsley currently has a national speed limit (70mph) and carries significant volumes of traffic past slip-roads with very poor intervisibility between vehicles joining and proceeding along the A34 at East Ilsley and Beedon. This results in frequent accidents.

attributes.action: A complete ban of the Hijab in our armed services and our emergency services.
attributes.background: The armed and emergency services are here to serve Britain. Anyone who moves here and wants to join should respect the role and the uniform.  It should not be changed to suit their needs. The face should be displayed at all times as its is a figure of respect.  The Hijab is a health & safety risk

attributes.action: Call Government to legislate & implement Lynn Faulds Wood Consumer Recall Report
attributes.background: The Lynn Faulds Wood review calls for an overhaul of the consumer product recall system in this country. This has been highlighted by the situation with Whirlpool. Without Government legislation, as one MP stated, companies will continue with 'corporate malpractice' with no thought for the consumer.
attributes.additional_details:
UK consumer product recall, An independent review by Lynn Faulds Wood
Adjournment debate by Andy Slaughter MP, Faulty Tumble Dryers (Fire Risk) on 13th September 2016

attributes.action: Remove Cannabis And Hemp From The 1971 Misuse Of Drugs Act
attributes.background: The law states cannabis has no medicinal value, science has shown cannabis has a vast medicinal profile and can help with a plethora of health problems humans have an endocannabinoid system with autoregulatory homeostatic mechanisms cannabinoids ARE FUNDAMENTAL for protection and maintenance
attributes.additional_details:
There is no scientific justification for the current scheduling of cannabis and hemp in the 1971 drugs act, the law violates the right to the highest attainable standard of health.The goverment must repeal the law to allow people to OBTAIN this FUNDAMENTAL SUPPLIMENT / FORTHWITH 
cannabis is available in 29 states of America,Spain,Holland,Canada,Portugal, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legality_of_cannabis_by_country

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Don't allow train companies to increase fares until they improve their service
attributes.background:
Set up an independent website where unhappy customers can log their journey disruptions easily. Train companies can't skew the figures and true results can be recorded.

If service is not kept to a high standard with trains running on time, then they are not permitted to raise their prices.
attributes.additional_details:
Train companies have announced price hikes yet again across the board. Service is worse than ever, but prices are rising. The Delay Repay scheme is nothing short of a joke.

My train was running so late that they terminated it halfway, throw all of us off so they could skip the rest of the stops and arrive on time.  That is a clear case of skewing their own statistics of how many trains arrive 'on time' - with no care for the disruption they cause their own customers.

attributes.action: petition the government to stop or at least suspend foreign aid
attributes.background: we have so many issues within the UK that we ned to re-examine whether we can afford foreign aid.
attributes.additional_details: We are struggling to maintain front line services, have people living from food banks in poverty and homelessness is on the rise. On the other hand we are spending a huge amount of money on foreign aid, giving it to countries who can afford to run a space program for example? We see on a daily basis that this money is abused - i believe this money would be better spent on issues within the UK supporting our own people.

attributes.action: Support Hong Kong's democracy or push for independence/return to British rule.
attributes.background: Since the 1997 handover the CCP (Chinese Communist Party) has been eroding the freedoms and rights of the people of Hong Kong, which is in breach of the terms which would protect Hong Kong till 2047 and the U.K. government has a legal responsibility to up hold the terms of the treaty.
attributes.additional_details:
There has been many indications that Hong Kong does not support the CCP; from the umbrella movement, the online poll in 2013 suggesting 9 out of 10 Hongkongers prefer British Rule or anti-Chinese parties and pundits.
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/06/26/hong-kong-democracy-campaigners-demand-return-to-british-rule-as/
http://www.rfa.org/english/news/china/hong-kong-03142013141313.html
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/sep/28/hong-kong-umbrella-movement-first-anniversary-democracy

attributes.action: Introduce legislation to protect officers tackling motorbike & auto crime
attributes.background: Police officers have high levels of training in pursuit driving & tactical resolutions yet are afraid to use tactics i.e. Stop stick on motorbikes. There is no protection in law if something goes wrong and an offender is hurt. Motorbikes fail to stop regularly, commit crime & police can't pursue.
attributes.additional_details: Many crimes are carried out on motorcycles, robberies, shootings & drug dealing. Police wont pursue in case the criminals hurt themselves & officers are scared to use stop stick in case the criminal gets injured & they get blamed. Recent incidents in Merseyside have seen up to 60 motorbikes causing mayhem at one time, many on stolen bikes, riding on pavements, through red lights etc. Legislation is needed to protect officers so they can tackle this problem effectively & put blame on offenders.

attributes.action: Scrap land factor maintenance arrangements by companies on housing estates.
attributes.background: New estates are burdened with extra maintenance charges from private companies. The industry is unregulated, uncontrolled and monopolised in such a manner that unfairly disadvantages residents
attributes.additional_details:
There are hundreds of new build estates across the UK that are burdened with extra charges to resident for the maintenance of the open shared spaces on their estates. The residents have no choice in which company carries out the work. The charges are over inflated, the quality of work is substandard and companies bully residents into continued payments with threats of legal action. 
There seems to be no clear way of complaint, and no independent way of arbitration or enforcement of standards.

attributes.action: Repeal the 1955 canal closure act.
attributes.background: Repeal the 1955 canal closure act.To prevent losing more of our Industrial Heritage.And stop developers building on disused canals and surrounding heritage.This will also give restoration groups the possibility of restoring derelict Canals.
attributes.additional_details: Without this act being repealed ,we cannot stop any Local authorities or CRT applying for a canal closure and granting planning permission on derelict canals or nearby heritage sites.

attributes.action: Allow paganism to be taught in religious education lessons
attributes.background: All religions should be covered in the curriculum not just the chosen few.  The younger members of society should be able to make an informed choice to what religions are around and what they stand for.

attributes.action: Increase the BASIC PAY for nurses in the NHS in line with the rise in inflation
attributes.background: Nurses and other allied health professionals pay have not had a substantial increase for many years now. We require the nurses and HCA's pay in NHS to be increased taking into account the inflation. They are a vital working group in NHS and deserve a better pay package than what they get at present.
attributes.additional_details: NHS is struggling with staffing issues and I being a nurse primarily see this as an issue because young nurses don't earn enough in the NHS and don't want to toil hard for considerably lesser amount of money. They are desperately in need of a pay rise and be in line with inflation rate. They have only received 1% pay rise in the last revision which was not a substantial increase anyway. If we have to attract more people have to come to nursing and caring they would have to be paid better.

attributes.action: Government to HONOUR Britain's Worst Maritime Disaster the RMS Lancastria
attributes.background: The Lancastria sank 17th June 1940 taking with it between 5-10,000 men women and children plus pets making it Britain's Worst maritime Disaster. France have recognised the sinking, Scotland has recognised the sinking with a medal plus monument on the Clyde 2011. What have the British done-NOTHING!
attributes.additional_details: After many years writing to the British Government regarding recognition for "Britains Worst maritime Disaster!" The government choosing every year to ignore pleas and cries of not only the survivors of the disaster but also the families of those lost. Last year stand in for our Prime Minister Osborne finally acknowledged that the disaster ever took place and stated it was now "appropriate" to recognise the sinking which has brought strange feelings of mistrust and anger amongst its Nation.

attributes.action: Proscribe the extremist group Britain First
attributes.background: Far right propaganda on the internet and social media is all pervasive. Britain First's Facebook page reaches and influences millions a week. The Govt must proscribe Britain First .
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/britain-first-muslim-elected-officials_uk_574352c4e4b0e71ef36d9617?edition=uk&b52pke8u54myousor

http://www.politics.co.uk/news/2014/06/19/britain-first-the-violent-new-face-of-british-fascism

These are just 2 of many links showing just how dangerous Britain First are.

attributes.action: Reinstate the NHS bursary funds for prospective 2017/2018 Nursing students.
attributes.background: The reason for this petition is that government claim there's shortage of nurses in the UK and yet they went ahead to stop the bursary that has been helpful for Nursing students to pay for their tuition fees .Government should reinstate the NHS  bursary funds to encouraging more people into nursing.

attributes.action: Ban all non-recyclable/non-compostable packaging in the UK
attributes.background:
The UK fails to recycle over 1.5 million tonnes of plastic packaging waste each year, which ends up in landfill & waterways instead. 

Creating packaging that our society cannot deal with is blatantly unsustainable. We urgently need 100% recyclable/compostable packaging on every product in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK currently recycles 64% of all packaging waste, but only about 32% of plastic packaging waste.

This is unacceptable. We cannot let big business create more packaging that our society cannot deal with - it may be good for profits but it is irresponsible and unsustainable.

We call upon our leaders to take action: to ban all non-sustainable packaging on all products, with a grace period of 5 years to allow manufacturers to integrate viable, sustainable alternatives into their supply chains.

attributes.action: Pass the same sentences for offences against animals as offences against humans
attributes.background: Every day you hear of terrible offences against animals, including cruelty, torture and murder. I propose the same sentencing for perpetrators of these crimes as there would be if they had committed the same offence against a human. The current sentences passed are too light.

attributes.action: Make egg manufacturers legally obliged to display a method of male chick culling
attributes.background:
UK legislation should provide an enforceable law that every egg pack produced in an egg factory must have a clearly visible and well readable statement what killing methods of male chicks are used in the given egg factory, for example:

"Method of male chick culling: Suffocation"
attributes.additional_details:
Chick culling is a common method of a male chick disposal as males don't lay eggs and are therefore unnecessary waste generating no financial or other profit for the egg industry.

It is morally unacceptable that egg manufacturers can accompany their products with images of happy hens whilst not revealing the information about this inhumane cruelty happening on a huge scale in their factory premises on a daily basis. That is effectively deceiving the consumers by a false advertisement.

attributes.action: Urgently increase the penalty for illegal fly tipping.
attributes.background: Incidents of large scale illegal fly tipping are occurring far to frequently and the fly tips are almost on an industrial scale, especially in rural areas. It is obvious to all that organised criminals have become involved and are profiting from fly tipping.
attributes.additional_details: There is no doubt that the crime of fly tipping is having a serious effect on the countryside, wildlife and communities - it can't be allowed to go on.

attributes.action: Give Ofcom power to enforce impartiality and accuracy of the BBC
attributes.background: Giving Ofcom the power to enforce this policy, for accurate information is essential to democracy. At present the BBC is failing the nation, discarding all pretence at impartiality and balanced reporting, becoming a voice for an international elite, & suppressing news not welcome to its own agenda.
attributes.additional_details:
The BBC has a unique position in British life; funded by the people individually, it belongs to all & has an ethical & constitutional duty to provide accurate & unbiased information & balanced comment. It has lamentably failed this duty in recent years, in Referendum debates, and even more so afterwards by hysterically talking down the future prospects of the country, increasing division, distrust, & anger & encouraging anxiety & fear in the young
more at http://www.facebook.com/BBCNewsPetition
